subject: Re: May this not be kicking a dead horse...
msgSnippet: ... Hello I have been using quikscript for approximately one year. In that time it has become indispensible to me in the area of handwritting. I would like to
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Michael Everson <everson@...> wrote:
>
> On 17 Apr 2010, at 21:32, tim_rice09 wrote:
>
> > Wow it's been a long time since I've been here.
> > I was searching the message logs and noticed that the last mention of getting QS into the official Unicode body was quite a while ago. I looked at the proposed chart available in the files section for this group and finally see how well adding QS into the Shavian codespace can work. Has anyone else thought any more about this?
>
> I did some preliminary work on it. WG2 begins tomorrow, so it is too late to get anything done on it now; the next meeting is in October.
>
> Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com/
>

Hello

I have been using quikscript for approximately one year. In that time it has become indispensible to me in the area of handwritting. I would like to be able to use quikscript when typing as well.

this is possible now if i use the "Thoth Int" font found elsewhere on this yahoo group. the downside being that since quikscript in not in unicode, that font borrows the codepoints for the latin alphabet. this makes it impossible to mix the two alphabets. as well i cannot type in quikscript without changing the font.

It is my intention to write an input method for quikscript using the ibus (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intelligent_Input_Bus) framework. there are a few steps required to make this a reality but the first is getting quikscript into unicode.

I have no particular expertise with unicode or the procedures but i am willing to volunteer in any way i can to help prepare the submission to the deciding body.

Cheers,

Brent
